name: Dicentra
description: Dicentra, commonly known as “Bleeding Heart”, is a genus of about 10 species of herbaceous plants in the family Papaveraceae, native to Asia and North America.Their outstanding characteristic is the shape of the flowers. Dicentra bears heart-shaped flowers hanging down in a row from arching stems, from which a little “drop of blood” dangles at the bottom, giving the plant a spectacular appearance. They bloom in spring and early summer and dies back to the ground as the heat of summer arrives.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Greek words “dis” (“twice”) and “kenton” (“spur”), referring to the flowers shape – two nectar-bearing spurs.
color_description: The flowers are usually red, pink and white.
